Very excited to have been invited by @colgateuniv's LGBTQIA+ Society (LAMBDA) to give an online talk about covid & mental health. 

I will be discussing my ongoing covid experience & the impact this has had on my work as an activist, creative practitioner & trainee therapist.

@ColgateLW @colgateuniv In a really literal sense, the drawings of hands on the pages signing words is really powerful for me. This is a collection concerned with being deaf, silence, language and communication, so including the images of hands speaks a lot that words cannot #ColgateLivingWriters

RT @ColgateLW: (1/2) ‚ÄúWhy not flood Twitter with poetry lines?‚Äù writes @ilya_poet in his @ColgateUniv Living Writers interview. 

Why not i‚Ä¶

@zannevine @ColgateLW @ilya_poet @colgateuniv This reminded me of my favorite poem, "Burial" by Ross Gay:

"my father
guffawed by kicking from the first bite
buckets of juice down my chin,
staining one of my two button-down shirts,
the salmon colored silk one, hollering
there‚Äôs more of that!
almost dancing now in the plum"

@ColgateLW @ilya_poet @colgateuniv Why not indeed! @ilya_poet is truly a professor of 5 senses. This reminds me of William Carlos Williams‚Äô plums. 
‚ÄúAll of us
still have to do the hard work of dentist appointments,
of remembering to make
a summer salad: basil, tomatoes, it is a joy, tomatoes, add a little salt.‚Äù

In the midst of COVID @PresidentCasey reminding the @colgateuniv community, students especially, to take care of yourself. 
#compassion #selfcare #Health
